judges: Before Jones, C. J., Ea-gen, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy, Nix and Manderino, JJ.

opinions.text:
Opinion
per Curiam,
The judgment of sentence is vacated and the record is remanded to the trial court with leave to appellant to file post-trial motions as if timely filed and upon the disposition of those motions, to pursue an appeal if he so desires.
opinions.author: per Curiam,

attorneys: Milton M. Stein, Assistant District Attorney, James D. Gratoford, Deputy District Attorney, Richcwd A. Sprague, First Assistant District Attorney, and Arlen Specter, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth v. Wideman, Appellant.
Submitted April 17, 1972.
Before Jones, C. J., Ea-gen, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy, Nix and Manderino, JJ.
Roy H. Davis, for appellant.
Milton M. Stein, Assistant District Attorney, James D. Gratoford, Deputy District Attorney, Richcwd A. Sprague, First Assistant District Attorney, and Arlen Specter, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
June 28, 1972:
